fields.description:
Nimbus kit is a great framework for ios development
You can find it [here|http://nimbuskit.info/]

By using it we could get feature very close to android, and would gain much time implementing new features.
For example html property for label
http://latest.docs.nimbuskit.info/NimbusAttributedLabel.html

or photoAlbum like gallery on android
http://latest.docs.nimbuskit.info/NimbusPhotos.html

Improved webview with toolbar
http://latest.docs.nimbuskit.info/NimbusWebController.html

We could also use to better manage network images
http://latest.docs.nimbuskit.info/NimbusNetworkImage.html

NiAttributeLabel already handle textalign and verticalAlign

And we could even think about using their great models to improve tableview management
http://latest.docs.nimbuskit.info/TableViewModels.html

I was about to start integrating it in my branch to get html property in labels, but i thought it was a better idea to first talk about it here.

What do you think?

comments.body: As cool as this sounds, there's no chance we'll ever do this. We've got way too much higher priority stuff to do. Sorry.
Closing ticket with reference to the previous comments.
